post_message: Amid a surge in violence in Milwaukee, the Republican-controlled Wisconsin Senate voted to repeal a state law that requires a two-day wait for handgun purchases. Just before the April 21, 2015, vote, the author of the bill, state Sen. Van Wanggaard, made this waiting-period claim: "There no statistical evidence that it reduces violence whatsoever," the Racine Republican declared.
